title: PY2 unicode issue in JSON handling
body:
All our JSON loading goes through a single function `datalad.support.json_py.load', which uses `load` from `simplejson`, and it behaves diffently between PY2 and PY3. Here is the demo:

```
% file .datalad/metadata/objects/c39/ds-480ad6f5b2402b32137a0e29f76e0
.datalad/metadata/objects/c39/ds-480ad6f5b2402b32137a0e29f76e0: UTF-8 Unicode text
% python3 -c "from io import open; from simplejson import load; print(load(open('.datalad/metadata/objects/c39/ds-480ad6f5b2402b32137a0e29f76e0', 'r', encoding='utf-8'))['unique_content_properties']['name'][17:19])"
['Creek Mary`s Blood', 'Creek Mary´s Blood']
% python -c "from io import open; from simplejson import load; print(load(open('.datalad/metadata/objects/c39/ds-480ad6f5b2402b32137a0e29f76e0', 'r', encoding='utf-8'))['unique_content_properties']['name'][17:19])" 
[u'Creek Mary`s Blood', u'Creek Mary\xb4s Blood']
```

Both times loading the extact same file, only correctly loaded in PY3.

I cut down the file to the relevant part, no change:

```
% file demo.txt
demo.txt: UTF-8 Unicode text
% python -c "from simplejson import load; print(load(open('demo.txt', 'r')))"
['Creek Mary`s Blood', u'Creek Mary\xb4s Blood']
% python3 -c "from simplejson import load; print(load(open('demo.txt', 'r')))"
['Creek Mary`s Blood', 'Creek Mary´s Blood']
```

We are using `io.open`  to feed the file to simplejson:

```
% python -c "from io import open; c=open('demo.txt', 'r', encoding='utf-8').read(); print(type(c)); print(c)"
<type 'unicode'>
["Creek Mary`s Blood","Creek Mary´s Blood"]
% python3 -c "from io import open; c=open('demo.txt', 'r', encoding='utf-8').read(); print(type(c)); print(c)"
<class 'str'>
["Creek Mary`s Blood","Creek Mary´s Blood"]
```

Any idea how to fix this?
